meanings.definition: The quality or state of being wicked.
meanings.sent1: Her wickedness was evident in the way she treated others.
meanings.sent2: The town was shocked by the wickedness of the crime.
meanings.sent3: Despite his wickedness, he always had a mischievous smile.
meanings.sent4: The wickedness of the storm left a path of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The wickedness of the villain was unmatched in the story.

meanings.sent1: The wickedness of cheating on the test was unacceptable.
meanings.sent2: Society must stand against the wickedness of corruption.
meanings.sent3: The wickedness of eating ice cream for breakfast made her giggle.
meanings.sent4: The wickedness of the lie spread like a dark shadow.
meanings.sent5: The wickedness of the dictator's actions haunted the nation.

meanings.sent1: His wickedness in stealing the cookies was discovered.
meanings.sent2: The wickedness of the betrayal cut deep.
meanings.sent3: The wickedness of the prank made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The wickedness of the decision lingered in the air.
meanings.sent5: The wickedness of the scheme was revealed in the end.
